did.abstract: Minute book of the United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America, Local 3211 (Herkimer, New York), from October 22, 1970 to April 11, 1974.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America often referred to as the United Brotherhood of Carpenters was formed in 1881. It has grown to be one of the largest trade unions in the United States, and between its chapters and locals there is international cooperation that poises the brotherhood for a global role. Today the United Brotherhood of Carpenters is considered one of North America's largest building-trades unions, with almost a half-million members in the construction and wood-products industries. Local 3211 is based in Herkimer, New York. Local 3211 was based in Herkimer, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of one minute book of the United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America, Local 3211 (Herkimer, New York), from October 22, 1970 to April 11, 1974.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America Local 3211 (Herkimer, NY) Minute Books #5828. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
